intro: Urostachys pithyoides, commonly known as the woolly pithyoides, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and hairy, grayish-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its unique morphology and ecological resilience make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
